p: Mashhad is the populous city (after Tehran) in Iran (3069941) and is the capital of Khorasan Razavi Province, located in the north-east of the country ( Fig. 1). The city is located at 36.20° North latitude and 59.35° East longitude, in the valley of the Kashaf River between the two mountain ranges of Binalood and Hezar-masjed. Mashhad features a steppe climate (Köppen BSk) with hot summers and cool winters. Summers are warm with average temperatures above 30 °C. However, real extremes in temperatures such as temperatures above 40 °C.
